meanings.definition: A person who has an irrational fear or aversion to computers.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a computerphobe and prefers to use pen and paper for everything.
meanings.sent2: The computerphobe in our office always asks for help when it comes to using the company's software.
meanings.sent3: The computerphobe joked that they would rather face a lion than turn on a computer.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of computers turned her into a computerphobe, avoiding all technology like the plague.
meanings.sent5: The computerphobe's heart races at the mere sight of a computer screen, feeling overwhelmed by the digital world.

meanings.definition: To have a strong dislike or fear of using computers.
meanings.sent1: I computerphobe whenever I have to deal with complicated software programs.
meanings.sent2: She computerphobes every time she is asked to troubleshoot computer issues.
meanings.sent3: He computerphobes so much that he refuses to even touch a keyboard.
meanings.sent4: The thought of having to use a computer makes her computerphobe uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: They computerphobe at the idea of having to navigate through endless computer menus and settings.
